DOC.brief_summary: This observational study evaluates peri-procedural results of the Niobe™ Remote Magnetic Navigation (RMN) ES system using the contact detection system (CDS) in patients undergoing standard of care radiofrequency ablation of atrial fibrillation. The objective of this observational study is to confirm system performance of the CDS and that it does not alter pacing, electrocardiograms, or mapping during RF ablation procedures.
DOC.brief_title: Prospective Physician-Initiated Observational Study of The Contact Detection System (CDS) in Patients Undergoing Radiofrequency Ablation Using the Niobe™ Remote Magnetic Navigation System
DOC.criteria: patients with a clinical indication for RF ablation of atrial fibrillation with the Niobe Remote Magnetic Navigation system patients referred to one of the participating ablation centers patients with a history of atrial fibrillation written informed consent presence of a atrial thrombus or left atrial appendage (LAA) thrombus seen on (contrast) echocardiography or MRI contraindication for general anesthesia age below 18 years
